bunpro.meaning: Not necessarily so, Is not always true, There is no guarantee that
bunpro.writeup: とは限らないis regularly used to convey the meaning of '(A) is not necessarily so', or 'there is no guarantee that (A)'. This expression utilizes thecase marking particleと in its use for highlightingresults, theadverbial particleは, and the negated form of the う - Verb限る 'to limit'.This structure may be used with verbs,い-Adjectives,な-Adjectives, or nouns. However,だwill be required afterな-Adjectivesand nouns.限らない literally means 'to not be bound', or 'to not be limited'. Therefore, despite と highlighting a result, that result is then being clarified as 'not the only possibility'.

examples.japanese: 日本に2年間住んでいるからといって、日本語を話せるとは限らない。
examples.english: It is not limited to a person being able to speak Japanese just because they have lived in Japan for 2 years.

examples.japanese: 日が出てても暖かいとは限らない。
examples.english: Just because the sun is out, doesn't necessarily mean that it is warm.

examples.japanese: 田舎でも静かだとは限らない。
examples.english: A place being rural doesn't necessarily mean that it is quiet.

examples.japanese: 社長だからといって乗っている車が高級車だとは限らない。
examples.english: It is not limited to him driving a luxury car, just because he is the CEO.

examples.japanese: すべての人間が上手に歌えるとは限らない。
examples.english: It is not necessarily true that everybody can sing well.

examples.japanese: 毎年の冬に必ず雪が降るとは限らない。
examples.english: It is not necessarily the case that it will snow every winter.

examples.japanese: 彼女が「愛している」と言ってくれても、離婚しないとは限らない。
examples.english: Just because she says she loves you doesn't necessarily mean you won't get a divorce.

examples.japanese: 裕福になっても、幸福になれるとは限らない。
examples.english: Even if you become rich, there is no guarantee that you will be happy.

examples.japanese: 君の言うことがいつも正しいとは限らないでしょ。
examples.english: The things you say are not necessarily always right.

false_friends.meaning: As long as, While… is the case, Limited to
There is no guarantee that…, Not necessarily
It is not that, It doesn't mean that, It is not always the case
Not always, Not entirely, Not necessarily
Is not impossible, It doesn't mean that it isn't
It doesn't mean that, It is not the case, It's not like

dojg.description: A phrase which expresses the idea "not necessarily".

examples.japanese: (ksa).体の弱い人が早く死ぬとは限らない。
examples.english: Frail  people do not necessarily die young.

examples.japanese: (ksb).高い物がいつも・必ずしも安い物よりいいとは限らない。
examples.english: Expensive  things are not always / necessarily better than inexpensive ones.

examples.japanese: (ksc).日本に長く住んでいるから(と言って)日本語が上手だとは限らない。
examples.english: It  is not necessarily the case that people are good at Japanese because they have  lived in Japan a long time.

examples.japanese: (ksd).日本に行っても日本語が上手になるとは限らない。
examples.english: You  will not necessarily become good at Japanese even if you go to Japan.

examples.japanese: (kse).お金があれば幸福になれるとは限らない。
examples.english: You  will not (literally: cannot) necessarily be happy if you have money.

examples.japanese: (a).漫画が子供の教育にとって有害だとは限らない。
examples.english: Comics  are not necessarily harmful to children's education.

examples.japanese: (b).日本人の使う日本語がいつも正しいとは限らない。
examples.english: The  Japanese used by Japanese people is not always correct.

examples.japanese: (c).スポーツ選手が必ずしも健康だとは限らない。
examples.english: Athletes  are not necessarily healthy.

examples.japanese: (d).技術の進歩が必ずしも我々に繁栄をもたらすとは限らない。
examples.english: Progress  in technology does not necessarily bring us prosperity.

examples.japanese: (e).先生がそう言ったからと言ってそれが正しいとは限らない。
examples.english: It  is not necessarily correct just because the teacher said so.

examples.japanese: (f).薬を飲んだからと言ってよくなるとは限らない。
examples.english: You  do not necessarily get better because you take medicine.

examples.japanese: (g).頭がよくても人生に成功するとは限らない。
examples.english: You  do not necessarily succeed in your life even if you are smart.

examples.japanese: (h).実力があっても失業しないとは限らない。
examples.english: It  is not necessarily true that you won't lose your job even if you have ability.

examples.japanese: (i).悪い家庭環境に育てば必ず悪い子供になるとは限らない。
examples.english: It  is not necessarily true that children become bad if they grow up in a bad  family environment.

examples.japanese: (j).時間が沢山あればいい論文が書けるとは限らない。
examples.english: It  is not necessarily true that you can write a good paper if you have a lot of  time.

dojg.formation:
## 

- Sinformal
- とは限らない
- よくなるとは限らない
- Someone will not necessarily get well
